intro: Hieracium nigrescens subsp. subglandulatum, commonly known as the glandular hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and basal leaves that are lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in a composite head, and bloom from late spring to early summer. The subspecies is distinguished by the presence of glandular structures on its leaves and stems, which contribute to its unique botanical features.
